jd: From: KhushankChauhan, Source Infotech khushank@sourceinfotech.com Reply to: khushank@sourceinfotech.com Lead Azure Integration DeveloperLocation: Cleveland, OH (Hybrid Onsite)Duration: 6 months C2HIV: Phone and VideoVisa: No H1b/CPT Here’s 5 focused skills the Integration Developer needs to have.1. Azure Cloud2. Azure Integration Design Patterns 3. Deployment Technologies4. Development 5. Leadership skills Job Description – Integration Developer and DesignerThe Integration Developer role is responsible for integrating leading technologies in the design of complex technology solutions across domains, while considering business goals, technical feasibility, and long-term scalability. This person will work with the integration and architecture teams, as well as application teams in and out of their own org reporting structure, as integrations span to those. In addition, they will foster collaboration among stakeholders to understand business needs and implement the best solutions to meet their needs, and support solutions 24x7 to cover systems needs.Responsibilities• Design and build integration solutions that are aligned to the organization’s business goals (e.g., speed, reliability, scalability)• Leverage expertise in domain-driven design principals to improve upon conceptual and logical models and advocate for their organization-wide adoption in adherence to architectural principles, policies, standards, and frameworks· Foster collaboration among various stakeholders across customer teams and lead discussion to drive understanding of integration value· Drive definition of work needed for application teams by facilitating discussion and creation of work cards, maintain work progress with team norms for agile tracking of the same· Provide technical expertise and training opportunities to empower technical teams in support of the implementation of integration design• Drive strategic communication regarding technical considerations and impacts to stakeholders helping them understand implications in detailKnowledge & Experience• 5-15 years of experience in building integrations and designing solutions, including synchronous and asynchronous data, transactional, and service-oriented patterns• Proven track record in designing and architecting complex systems at the functional or enterprise level• Expertise in technology integration and the design of interfaces between systems• Expertise in Software Development Lifecycle Methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, etc.)• Experience with EDA (Event Driven Architecture) and platforms such as Kafka, Azure Integration Services, Confluent, Solace etc.• Experience with Devops and CI/CD methodologies • Background and familiarity with cloud and infrastructure platforms to support HA and resiliency • Analytical and problem-solving skillsTechnical Skills• Cloud Technologies & Platforms including infrastructure automation using Terraform, Puppet, or Ansible• CI/CD processes, GitHub Actions, Jenkins, or Azure DevOps• Understanding of integrations tools like Talend/Informatica, Boomi, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Data Factory/Synapse• Web Services, APIs, Microservices, and SOA• Application and Data Architecture as related to Integration• Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) Methodology• Emerging Technologies and Automation Tools• Change Management
